text:
2 questions:
1. What's the VSCode friendly way of setting up BenchmarkTools, Revise and OhMyREPL as a startup image? With the clickbox on settings + PackageCompiler?
2. Does anyone else use a vim movement keys extension? My nvim vscode extension is super janky and sometimes becomes unresponsive and I need to relaod vscode - very aggravating. Has anyone had any success with a particular vim extension or faced this problem before?
Thx!

elements.text: What's the VSCode friendly way of setting up BenchmarkTools, Revise and OhMyREPL as a startup image? With the clickbox on settings + PackageCompiler?

2. Does anyone else use a vim movement keys extension? My nvim vscode extension is super janky and sometimes becomes unresponsive and I need to relaod vscode - very aggravating. Has anyone had any success with a particular vim extension or faced this problem before?
Thx!

text:
I use this extension and it's pretty good! <https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscodevim.vim>

It's about on par with other vim emulators I've used. The macro system works ok, the regexp/replace system works ok. The only real problem I can remember is that pasting visual blocks doesn't work block-wise.

attachments.title: Vim - Visual Studio Marketplace
attachments.text: Extension for Visual Studio Code - Vim emulation for Visual Studio Code

elements.text: I use this extension and it's pretty good!

It's about on par with other vim emulators I've used. The macro system works ok, the regexp/replace system works ok. The only real problem I can remember is that pasting visual blocks doesn't work block-wise.

text: I haven't had any particularly annoying issues with the nvim extension. There are a bunch of things you shouldn't have in your vimrc for everything to work properly though

elements.text: I haven't had any particularly annoying issues with the nvim extension. There are a bunch of things you shouldn't have in your vimrc for everything to work properly though
